metadata.title: CVE-2023-5157 on Ubuntu 23.10 (mantic) - medium
metadata.description:
A vulnerability was found in MariaDB. An OpenVAS port scan on ports 3306and 4567 allows a malicious remote client to cause a denial of service.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-5157` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libmariadb3 - 1:10.8.4
libmariadbd19 - 1:10.8.4
mariadb-backup - 1:10.8.4
mariadb-client - 1:10.8.4
mariadb-client-core - 1:10.8.4
mariadb-common - 1:10.8.4
mariadb-plugin-connect - 1:10.8.4
mariadb-plugin-cracklib-password-check - 1:10.8.4
mariadb-plugin-gssapi-client - 1:10.8.4
mariadb-plugin-gssapi-server - 1:10.8.4
mariadb-plugin-hashicorp-key-management - 1:10.8.4
mariadb-plugin-mroonga - 1:10.8.4
mariadb-plugin-oqgraph - 1:10.8.4
mariadb-plugin-provider-bzip2 - 1:10.8.4
mariadb-plugin-provider-lz4 - 1:10.8.4
mariadb-plugin-provider-lzma - 1:10.8.4
mariadb-plugin-provider-lzo - 1:10.8.4
mariadb-plugin-provider-snappy - 1:10.8.4
mariadb-plugin-rocksdb - 1:10.8.4
mariadb-plugin-s3 - 1:10.8.4
mariadb-plugin-spider - 1:10.8.4
mariadb-server - 1:10.8.4
mariadb-server-core - 1:10.8.4
mariadb-test - 1:10.8.4
mariadb-test-data - 1:10.8.4
No subscription required

criterions.comment: mariadb package in mantic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1:10.8.4').
